properties.areaDesc: Northern Dona Ana County; Eastern/Central El Paso County; Southern Tularosa Basin; Central Tularosa Basin; Southern Dona Ana County/Mesilla Valley; Western El Paso County
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 4 at 5:05AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
A strong cold front is expected to bring snow to portions of the
Borderland on Wednesday morning with light snow possible for Las
Cruces, El Paso, and Alamogordo. Snowfall accumulations of a trace
to under 1 inch look possible. Even these light amounts could be
enough to bring some travel difficulties for the morning commute
for US-70 between Las Cruces and Alamogordo, I-10 between El Paso
and Las Cruces, and for the El Paso metro area. Travel across San
Andres Pass and Transmountain Pass could be particularly
difficult. Heaviest snowfall amounts Wednesday morning should
remain just east of the El Paso metro area, over Hudspeth and
Otero counties, and possibly far eastern El Paso county. These
areas could see snow amounts of 1 to 3 inches, with a few
locations possibly reaching 5 inches. Continue to monitor the
latest forecast for any changes in snowfall totals and for the
potential of any weather advisories as some uncertainty remains on
how much snow will fall for Las Cruces and El Paso as there will
be a sharp cut-off in the northern and western extent of snow.

NWSheadline: LIGHT SNOWFALL AMOUNTS COULD BRING MINOR IMPACTS TO WEDNESDAY MORNING COMMUTE TO EL PASO, LAS CRUCES, AND ALAMOGORDO
